alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 19 at 10:13AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 115 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1005 AM HST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated that a band of heavy rain is moving over the island of Kauai. Barking Sands received nearly 1 inch of rain in 30 minutes, suggesting that rain is falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Showers will continue to overspread the island through early afternoon as a front approaches and moves over the island. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... the entire island of Kauai. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 115 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
